Responsibilities Assists the Software QA Analyst on developing test plans. Performs QA testing using approved test plans and test cases. Record QA defects and results as identified by the team. Contributes to the continuous improvement of the quality assurance processes and practices. Work Schedule 37.5 hours per week. This is a full-time temporary assignment for approximately six (6) months. Work Designation Hybrid This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C. Rate of Pay Salary $5,339.08 - $6,398.32 per month (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity). The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan upon eligibility. Focus on your development through training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer. Job Requirements Qualifications EDUCATION Requires completion of a minimum of two (2) years post-secondary education in an undergraduate degree program in computer science, or computer systems engineering, or software engineering or mathematics from a recognized university or technology institution with courses in business and systems analysis, software design and testing, and use of software testing tools. EXPERIENCE Requires three (3) months of recent related experience in the testing of commercial software and web applications through the use of software testing processes and methodologies, commercial test frameworks, test automation tools, and test tracking tools. Other Information Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process.
